title: PSA | Riot and the Boards lost the goal of the ADC nerfs
body:
ADCs were nerfed not just because they were OP and dished out damage, but because it was the starting point to fix League with its large amount of damage throughout the game.

The goal we lost was that ADCs weren't the only ones doing a lot of damage. There were other problematic factors but ADCs were a good starting point. The objective was to start there and slowly nerf everything else so towers survive longer, games are healthier, strategy can be implemented, and the game isn't just this linear fest of gold and damage.

replies.body: Damage isnt "too high". If you build full damage, you SHOULD be doing insane damage, and kill people quickly. Likewise, if you build no defenses, you SHOULD die instantly.

Damage absolutely is too high. It's true that building only damage and no defense is supposed to make you deal a lot of damage and die easily, but if this is brought to such an extreme that every game it's expected to see multiple <2 sec 100-0's, then you're hardly playing the game anymore. It's not fun to have fights decided solely by who clicks on their enemy first. There's no skill expression in that.

There is plenty of skill expression. Dancing around enemy threat lines, warding properly, not running off solo and expecting to live overextending, getting a good pick/engage. And the only people instantly dying are the squishies who SHOULD be behind the tanks. And no, tanks dont die instantly. If you die instantly as a tank, stop building IE on rammus.

Combat is what makes the game fun.

Nobody has fun warding. Nobody has fun dancing around enemy threat lines.

I have fun in combat, and when everyone is dying in 1 second it is not fun.

It's actually the opposite of fun. it is stressful.

That has nothing to do with my statement. They said there was no skill expression, there is.

As to what is fun or not, thats highly subjective and not a good argument to make, especially since the most fun game modes are aram and nexus blitz, both of which are full on fiesta fests with everyone constantly dying.

From the beginning of this initiative, I assumed the game would be put into an out-of-balance state as damage was brought down in different aspects.

The damage is distributed across champion kits, items, and runes. Damage is also diverse, ranging from flat values to percentage values and damage type (magic, physical, true).
So, it's impossible to straight nerf everything in one shot.
Imbalance is therefore inevitable until the damage state is brought close to intended levels and tweaks are made to rebalance overall game state.

The first time I saw an "OMG, ADCs are so weak" post on the boards, I thought _Well, this isn't going to go well_
I know it's hard, but short term imbalance when design is moving in an intended direction is necessary - even if that imbalance is purposeful weakness aka a champ/class/item/rune becomes underpowered for a time.
